korean: 요즘 저녁마다 산책을 나가는데, 생각보다 괜찮더라고.
처음엔 그냥 운동 좀 하려고 시작한 건데, 이젠 습관이 됐어.
보통 8시쯤 나가는데, 그때가 날씨도 적당하고 사람도 적당해.
동네 한 바퀴 도는 데 대충 30분 정도 걸려.
이어폰 끼고 음악 들으면서 걷는데, 완전 힐링이야.
가끔 아는 사람 마주치면 가볍게 인사하고 지나가고.
공원 벤치에 앉아서 잠깐 쉴 때도 있는데, 그때가 제일 좋아.
하루 종일 쌓인 스트레스가 좀 풀리는 느낌?
솔직히 운동 효과는 잘 모르겠는데, 정신 건강엔 확실히 도움 돼.
날씨 안 좋으면 안 나가고 싶지만, 나가고 나면 후회한 적 없어.
겨울엔 좀 춥긴 한데, 옷 두껍게 입으면 괜찮아.
집에 돌아와서 샤워하고 나면 몸이 개운해져.
자기 전에 산책하면 잠도 더 잘 오는 것 같아.
english: I've been going for evening walks lately, and it's actually pretty nice, you know?
At first, I just started it to get some exercise, but now it's become a habit.
I usually go out around 8, when the weather's decent and there aren't too many people.
Walking around the neighborhood takes like, roughly 30 minutes.
I listen to music with my earbuds while walking, and it's totally relaxing.
Sometimes when I run into someone I know, we just kind of say hi and pass by.
I sit on a park bench and rest for a bit sometimes, and that's the best part.
It feels like the stress from the whole day sort of melts away, you know?
Honestly, I don't know about the exercise benefits, but it definitely helps with mental health.
When the weather's bad I don't want to go out, but I've never regretted it after I do.
It's a bit cold in winter, but if you dress warmly it's fine.
After I get home and shower, my body feels so refreshed.
I feel like I sleep better when I walk before bed.
If the weather's okay tomorrow, I'm planning to go out again.
